title: Highest Multilateral Debt Service
description: In 2023, Afghanistan's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, indicating a significant financial burden.

title: High Goods and Services Expense
description: In 2017, 54.78% of Afghanistan's total expenses were allocated to goods and services, reflecting a substantial portion of the national budget.

title: Prevalence of Gender-Based Violence
description: In 2015, 46.1% of Afghan women aged 15-49 reported experiencing physical or sexual violence in the past year, highlighting a critical social issue.

title: Cultural Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2015, 80.2% of Afghan women believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for any of five reasons, indicating deeply rooted cultural norms.

title: High Mortality from Air Pollution
description: In 2019, the mortality rate attributed to household and ambient air pollution among Afghan females was 265 per 100,000, underscoring environmental health challenges.

title: Significant Health Expenditure Impact on Poverty
description: In 2020, 6.5% of Afghanistan's population was pushed below the 60% median consumption poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenditures.

title: High Current Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Afghanistan's current health expenditure was 23.09% of its GDP, reflecting a substantial allocation of resources to healthcare.

title: High Rate of Female Contributing Family Workers
description: In 2023, 66.78% of employed Afghan women were contributing family workers, indicating a reliance on unpaid family labor.

title: High Female Youth Not in Education, Employment, or Training
description: In 2024, 82.60% of Afghan female youth were not engaged in education, employment, or training, reflecting limited opportunities for young women.

title: High Merchandise Imports from MENA
description: In 2023, 23.68% of Afghanistan's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies in the Middle East & North Africa, indicating regional trade dependencies.

title: Lowest Water Productivity
description: In 2021, Afghanistan had a water productivity of only 0.81 constant 2015 US$ GDP per cubic meter of total freshwater withdrawal, indicating significant inefficiency in water use.

title: Minimal Domestic Credit to Private Sector
description: In 2020, domestic credit to the private sector by banks was just 2.99% of GDP, highlighting limited financial support for private enterprises.

title: Negative Net Domestic Credit
description: Afghanistan's net domestic credit was negative, at -79.38 billion LCU in 2020, reflecting a challenging financial environment.

title: Deflationary Economy
description: In 2024, Afghanistan experienced a deflation rate of -6.60%, indicating a decrease in consumer prices and potential economic stagnation.

title: Low Government Budget Utilization
description: Primary government expenditures were only 48.67% of the original approved budget in 2021, suggesting inefficiencies in budget execution.

title: Weak Economic Management
description: The CPIA economic management cluster average was 1.17 in 2023, indicating poor economic governance and management.

title: Poor Fiscal Policy
description: Afghanistan's CPIA fiscal policy rating was 1.0 in 2023, reflecting inadequate fiscal management and policy formulation.

title: Gender Inequality in Education
description: The gender parity index for literacy among youth aged 15-24 was 0.54 in 2022, highlighting significant gender disparities in education.

title: Low Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, the ratio of female to male labor force participation was only 7.30%, indicating a significant gender gap in employment.

title: Minimal Health Expenditure
description: Domestic general government health expenditure per capita was just $0.63 in 2022, reflecting limited investment in public health.
